storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to detect overlapping appointments in real-time to prevent double-booking

testCases.title: Validate detection of overlapping appointments
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
User has permissions to create and modify appointments
Appointment database is accessible and operational
No existing appointments in the test time slot
Real-time conflict detection service is running

steps.action: Navigate to the appointment creation page
steps.expectedResult: Appointment creation form is displayed with all required fields

steps.action: Enter appointment details: Date: Today's date, Start time: 10:00 AM, End time: 11:00 AM, Resource: Conference Room A, Client: Test Client 1
steps.expectedResult: All appointment details are populated in the form fields

steps.action: Click 'Save' button to create the appointment
steps.expectedResult: Appointment is saved successfully, confirmation message is displayed, and appointment appears in the schedule

steps.action: Navigate to create a new appointment
steps.expectedResult: New appointment creation form is displayed

steps.action: Enter overlapping appointment details: Date: Today's date, Start time: 10:30 AM, End time: 11:30 AM, Resource: Conference Room A, Client: Test Client 2
steps.expectedResult: Appointment details are entered in the form

steps.action: Click 'Save' button or tab out of the time field to trigger validation
steps.expectedResult: System detects conflict within 1 second and displays conflict warning message showing the overlapping appointment details (10:00 AM - 11:00 AM with Test Client 1)

steps.action: Attempt to save the overlapping appointment without providing override justification
steps.expectedResult: System prevents saving the appointment and displays conflict error message: 'Cannot save appointment due to conflict with existing appointment. Override required.'

steps.action: Verify the conflicting appointment details are displayed including: original appointment time, resource, and client information
steps.expectedResult: Conflict details clearly show: Appointment 1 (10:00 AM - 11:00 AM, Conference Room A, Test Client 1) conflicts with new appointment (10:30 AM - 11:30 AM, Conference Room A, Test Client 2)

postconditions: Only the first appointment (10:00 AM - 11:00 AM) exists in the system
Overlapping appointment is not saved
Conflict detection log entry is created
No double-booking exists in the schedule

testCases.title: Verify configurable conflict detection rules
preconditions: User is logged in with Admin or Scheduler role
User has permissions to configure conflict detection rules
Conflict rules configuration interface is accessible
At least one default conflict rule exists in the system
Test appointment types are defined in the system

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Conflict Detection Rules configuration page
steps.expectedResult: Conflict detection rules configuration page is displayed showing existing rules

steps.action: Click 'Add New Rule' button
steps.expectedResult: New rule creation form is displayed with fields for rule name, appointment type, overlap threshold, and priority

steps.action: Configure a new conflict rule: Rule Name: 'VIP Client Rule', Appointment Type: 'VIP Consultation', Overlap Allowed: 0 minutes, Priority: High, Status: Active
steps.expectedResult: Rule details are entered in all fields

steps.action: Click 'Save Rule' button
steps.expectedResult: Rule is saved successfully, confirmation message is displayed, and 'VIP Client Rule' appears in the active rules list

steps.action: Navigate to appointment creation page
steps.expectedResult: Appointment creation form is displayed

steps.action: Create first appointment: Type: 'VIP Consultation', Date: Tomorrow, Time: 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM, Resource: Room 1
steps.expectedResult: VIP appointment is created successfully

steps.action: Create second appointment: Type: 'VIP Consultation', Date: Tomorrow, Time: 2:30 PM - 3:30 PM, Resource: Room 1
steps.expectedResult: System applies 'VIP Client Rule' and immediately detects conflict, displaying error message that no overlap is allowed for VIP consultations

steps.action: Navigate back to Conflict Detection Rules configuration
steps.expectedResult: Rules configuration page is displayed

steps.action: Modify 'VIP Client Rule': Change Overlap Allowed from 0 minutes to 15 minutes, click 'Save'
steps.expectedResult: Rule modification is saved successfully with confirmation message

steps.action: Return to appointment creation and attempt to create the same overlapping appointment: Type: 'VIP Consultation', Date: Tomorrow, Time: 2:30 PM - 3:30 PM, Resource: Room 1
steps.expectedResult: System applies updated rule and still flags conflict because overlap (30 minutes) exceeds the allowed threshold (15 minutes)

steps.action: Create a different overlapping appointment: Type: 'VIP Consultation', Date: Tomorrow, Time: 2:50 PM - 3:50 PM, Resource: Room 1
steps.expectedResult: System applies updated rule and allows the appointment because overlap (10 minutes) is within the allowed threshold (15 minutes)

postconditions: Modified conflict detection rule is active and applied
Appointments created according to rule thresholds are saved
Appointments violating rule thresholds are blocked
Rule change is logged in audit trail

testCases.title: Ensure conflict detection latency is under 1 second
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Performance monitoring tools are available and configured
System is running under normal load conditions
Network latency is within acceptable range (<100ms)
Test appointments and resources are prepared
Browser developer tools or performance monitoring enabled

steps.action: Open browser developer tools and navigate to Network tab to monitor API response times
steps.expectedResult: Developer tools are open and ready to capture network activity

steps.action: Navigate to appointment creation page and create a baseline appointment: Date: Today, Time: 3:00 PM - 4:00 PM, Resource: Room A
steps.expectedResult: Appointment is created successfully

steps.action: Start timer and create a conflicting appointment: Date: Today, Time: 3:30 PM - 4:30 PM, Resource: Room A
steps.expectedResult: Conflict detection is triggered

steps.action: Measure the time from clicking 'Save' or tabbing out of time field until conflict warning appears on screen
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is detected and displayed within 1 second (≤1000ms), verified by timestamp in developer tools and visual observation

steps.action: Check the Network tab for the conflict detection API call response time
steps.expectedResult: API response time for POST /api/appointments or conflict validation endpoint is under 1 second

steps.action: Update an existing appointment to create a conflict: Change the 3:00 PM appointment end time to 5:00 PM, creating overlap with another appointment at 4:30 PM
steps.expectedResult: System detects conflict during update operation within 1 second

steps.action: Verify update conflict detection latency in Network tab
steps.expectedResult: PUT /api/appointments/{id} response time shows conflict detection completed in under 1 second

steps.action: Prepare to simulate high load: Open 5 browser tabs/windows with appointment creation forms
steps.expectedResult: Multiple appointment creation interfaces are ready

steps.action: Simultaneously create 5 appointments with overlapping times across all tabs within a 10-second window: Tab 1: 5:00-6:00 PM, Tab 2: 5:15-6:15 PM, Tab 3: 5:30-6:30 PM, Tab 4: 5:45-6:45 PM, Tab 5: 5:50-6:50 PM, all for Resource: Room B
steps.expectedResult: All conflict detections are triggered

steps.action: Monitor and record the conflict detection response time for each concurrent appointment creation
steps.expectedResult: Each conflict detection completes within 1 second despite concurrent load, system maintains SLA requirements with latency ≤1000ms for all 5 operations

steps.action: Review performance monitoring logs or metrics dashboard for conflict detection latency statistics
steps.expectedResult: Average, median, and 95th percentile latency metrics all show values under 1 second for the test period

postconditions: All conflict detection operations completed within 1 second SLA
Performance metrics are logged and available for review
System maintained performance under concurrent load
No appointments with conflicts were saved
Performance test results are documented

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to support configurable conflict detection rules to adapt to different scheduling scenarios

testCases.title: Validate creation and modification of conflict detection rules
preconditions: User is logged in with Admin role
User has permissions to manage conflict detection rules
Conflict rule configuration UI is accessible
Database connection is active
At least one existing conflict rule is present for reference

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Conflict Detection Rules or Administration > Rule Management
steps.expectedResult: Conflict rule configuration UI is displayed showing a list of existing rules with columns for rule name, type, status, and actions

steps.action: Review the existing rules displayed in the list
steps.expectedResult: All existing conflict detection rules are visible with their current configurations including rule names, appointment types, overlap thresholds, and active/inactive status

steps.action: Click 'Create New Rule' or 'Add Rule' button
steps.expectedResult: New rule creation form is displayed with empty fields for: Rule Name, Description, Appointment Type, Overlap Threshold (minutes), Priority Level, Exception Cases, and Active Status toggle

steps.action: Enter new rule details: Rule Name: 'Standard Consultation Rule', Description: 'Default rule for standard consultations', Appointment Type: 'Standard Consultation', Overlap Threshold: 0 minutes, Priority: Medium, Active: Yes
steps.expectedResult: All fields are populated with the entered values

steps.action: Click 'Save' button
steps.expectedResult: Rule is saved successfully, success confirmation message is displayed ('Rule created successfully'), and the page returns to the rules list view

steps.action: Verify the new rule 'Standard Consultation Rule' appears in the rules list
steps.expectedResult: New rule is visible in the list with all configured details displayed correctly: Name, Type, Overlap: 0 min, Priority: Medium, Status: Active

steps.action: Locate an existing rule in the list and click 'Edit' or the rule name to modify it
steps.expectedResult: Rule modification form is displayed with all current values pre-populated in the fields

steps.action: Modify the rule: Change Overlap Threshold from current value to 10 minutes, Update Description to include 'Updated on [current date]'
steps.expectedResult: Modified values are reflected in the form fields

steps.action: Click 'Save Changes' button
steps.expectedResult: Changes are saved successfully, confirmation message is displayed ('Rule updated successfully'), and the updated rule shows the new values in the rules list

steps.action: Verify the modified rule displays updated information in the rules list
steps.expectedResult: Rule shows updated Overlap Threshold (10 minutes) and updated description, modification timestamp is updated

steps.action: Navigate away from the rules page and return to verify persistence
steps.expectedResult: All created and modified rules persist with their saved configurations intact

postconditions: New conflict detection rule is created and active in the system
Modified rule changes are persisted in the database
All rule changes are logged in the audit trail
Rules are immediately available for conflict detection operations

testCases.title: Verify rule validation and error handling
preconditions: User is logged in with Admin role
User has permissions to create and modify conflict rules
Conflict rule configuration UI is accessible
System validation rules are active and configured

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Conflict Detection Rules configuration page
steps.expectedResult: Conflict rule configuration UI is displayed

steps.action: Click 'Create New Rule' button
steps.expectedResult: New rule creation form is displayed with empty fields

steps.action: Enter invalid rule syntax in the Overlap Threshold field: Enter text 'invalid' instead of a numeric value
steps.expectedResult: Field accepts the input temporarily

steps.action: Click 'Save' button to attempt saving the rule with invalid syntax
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error message: 'Overlap Threshold must be a numeric value' or 'Invalid input format', error is highlighted on the Overlap Threshold field, and rule is not saved

steps.action: Clear the Overlap Threshold field and leave Rule Name field empty, then click 'Save'
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error: 'Rule Name is required' and prevents saving

steps.action: Enter a negative number in Overlap Threshold field: -5
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error: 'Overlap Threshold must be a positive number or zero' and prevents saving

steps.action: Enter an excessively large number in Overlap Threshold field: 999999
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error: 'Overlap Threshold exceeds maximum allowed value' or accepts if within business logic limits

steps.action: Correct all validation errors: Rule Name: 'Test Valid Rule', Overlap Threshold: 15 (valid numeric value), Appointment Type: Select from dropdown, Priority: Medium
steps.expectedResult: All fields contain valid values, no validation errors are displayed

steps.action: Click 'Save' button
steps.expectedResult: Rule is accepted and saved successfully, confirmation message is displayed: 'Rule created successfully', and rule appears in the rules list

steps.action: Attempt to create a duplicate rule with the same Rule Name: 'Test Valid Rule'
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error: 'A rule with this name already exists' and prevents saving the duplicate

steps.action: Verify that the rules list shows only the valid saved rule without any invalid entries
steps.expectedResult: Only valid, successfully saved rules are displayed in the list, no invalid rules were persisted

postconditions: Only valid rules are saved in the system
Invalid rule attempts are rejected and logged
No corrupt or invalid data exists in the rules database
User receives clear feedback on validation errors

testCases.title: Ensure dynamic application of rules during conflict detection
preconditions: User is logged in with Admin or Scheduler role
User has permissions to configure rules and create appointments
Conflict detection service is running and operational
No existing appointments in the test time slots
At least one configurable rule exists or can be created

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Conflict Detection Rules configuration
steps.expectedResult: Conflict rules configuration page is displayed

steps.action: Create a new rule allowing specific overlap: Rule Name: 'Flexible Meeting Rule', Appointment Type: 'Team Meeting', Overlap Allowed: 20 minutes, Priority: Low, Status: Active
steps.expectedResult: Rule is created and saved successfully

steps.action: Click 'Save' and verify the rule status shows as 'Active'
steps.expectedResult: Rule is active and displayed in the active rules list with status indicator showing 'Active' or green checkmark

steps.action: Navigate to appointment creation page
steps.expectedResult: Appointment creation form is displayed

steps.action: Create first appointment: Type: 'Team Meeting', Date: Tomorrow, Start Time: 10:00 AM, End Time: 11:00 AM, Resource: Conference Room C
steps.expectedResult: Appointment is created successfully and appears in the schedule

steps.action: Create second overlapping appointment within allowed threshold: Type: 'Team Meeting', Date: Tomorrow, Start Time: 10:45 AM (15 minutes overlap), End Time: 11:45 AM, Resource: Conference Room C
steps.expectedResult: System applies 'Flexible Meeting Rule', calculates overlap as 15 minutes, determines it is within the 20-minute threshold, and does NOT flag a conflict

steps.action: Click 'Save' on the second appointment
steps.expectedResult: Appointment is saved successfully without conflict warning, confirmation message is displayed, and both appointments appear in the schedule

steps.action: Create third overlapping appointment exceeding allowed threshold: Type: 'Team Meeting', Date: Tomorrow, Start Time: 10:30 AM (30 minutes overlap), End Time: 11:30 AM, Resource: Conference Room C
steps.expectedResult: System applies 'Flexible Meeting Rule', calculates overlap as 30 minutes, determines it exceeds the 20-minute threshold

steps.action: Observe system response when attempting to save the third appointment
steps.expectedResult: System flags a conflict, displays error message: 'Appointment overlap (30 minutes) exceeds allowed threshold (20 minutes) for Team Meeting type', and prevents saving without override

steps.action: Verify conflict details show: Conflicting appointment time, overlap duration (30 minutes), allowed threshold (20 minutes), and rule name applied
steps.expectedResult: All conflict details are clearly displayed including which rule was applied and why the conflict was flagged

steps.action: Cancel the third appointment creation and verify only the two valid appointments exist in the schedule
steps.expectedResult: Schedule shows only the first appointment (10:00-11:00 AM) and second appointment (10:45-11:45 AM), third conflicting appointment was not saved

postconditions: Configured rule is actively applied during conflict detection
Appointments within overlap threshold are successfully saved
Appointments exceeding overlap threshold are blocked
Rule application is logged for audit purposes
Schedule integrity is maintained according to configured rules

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to handle concurrent scheduling updates without missing conflicts to maintain data integrity

testCases.title: Validate conflict detection under concurrent schedule updates
preconditions: Scheduling system is operational and accessible
Multiple test user accounts with scheduler role are created and authenticated
Scheduling database has concurrency controls enabled
Test appointments with overlapping time slots are prepared
System logging is enabled and configured
API endpoint PUT /api/appointments/{id} is available
Network connectivity is stable for all test users

steps.action: Set up 5 concurrent user sessions with valid authentication tokens
steps.expectedResult: All 5 user sessions are authenticated and ready to perform schedule updates

steps.action: Prepare overlapping appointment data: User1 schedules Room A from 10:00-11:00, User2 schedules Room A from 10:30-11:30, User3 schedules Room A from 10:15-11:15
steps.expectedResult: Test data is prepared with intentional time and resource conflicts

steps.action: Simultaneously trigger PUT /api/appointments/{id} requests from all 5 users within a 100ms window
steps.expectedResult: System receives all concurrent update requests without connection errors or timeouts

steps.action: Monitor API responses for each concurrent request
steps.expectedResult: System processes all updates and returns appropriate HTTP status codes (200 for success, 409 for conflicts) without errors or crashes

steps.action: Query the scheduling database to retrieve all appointments created in the test window
steps.expectedResult: All valid appointments are saved correctly, conflicting appointments are flagged with conflict status

steps.action: Verify conflict detection results by checking each overlapping appointment for conflict flags
steps.expectedResult: All 3 overlapping Room A appointments are detected and flagged as conflicts with no false negatives

steps.action: Check conflict alert queue or notification system for generated alerts
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alerts are generated for all detected conflicts (minimum 2 conflicts for the 3 overlapping appointments)

steps.action: Access system logs and filter for concurrency events during the test execution window
steps.expectedResult: System logs contain entries for all 5 concurrent update requests with timestamps, user IDs, and appointment IDs

steps.action: Verify log entries include conflict detection events with details of conflicting appointments
steps.expectedResult: All conflict events are logged accurately with conflict type, affected appointments, and detection timestamp

steps.action: Validate data integrity by checking for duplicate appointments or missing records
steps.expectedResult: No data corruption detected, all appointments are uniquely identified, no records are lost or duplicated

postconditions: All concurrent updates are processed and recorded in the database
Conflict flags are accurately set for overlapping appointments
System logs contain complete audit trail of concurrent operations
No data corruption or inconsistencies exist in the scheduling database
Conflict alerts are queued for user notification
System remains stable and operational for subsequent operations

testCases.title: Ensure system performance under concurrent load
preconditions: Scheduling system is operational with performance monitoring enabled
Load testing tools are configured and ready (e.g., JMeter, LoadRunner)
Performance baseline metrics are established
System resource monitoring tools are active (CPU, memory, database connections)
Test dataset with 1000+ appointments is loaded in the database
Network bandwidth is sufficient for high-volume concurrent requests
Performance SLA threshold is defined: conflict detection latency < 1 second

steps.action: Configure load testing tool to simulate 100 concurrent users performing schedule updates
steps.expectedResult: Load testing tool is configured with 100 virtual users, each with valid authentication credentials

steps.action: Prepare test data with 500 appointment update requests including 50 intentional conflicts
steps.expectedResult: Test dataset is loaded with varied appointment times, resources, and conflict scenarios

steps.action: Start system resource monitoring for CPU usage, memory consumption, database connections, and network I/O
steps.expectedResult: Monitoring dashboards display real-time metrics with baseline values recorded

steps.action: Initiate load test to generate high volume of concurrent schedule updates over a 5-minute duration
steps.expectedResult: Load test executes successfully, generating 500 PUT /api/appointments/{id} requests from 100 concurrent users

steps.action: Monitor API response times for each request during the load test
steps.expectedResult: System responds to all requests with response times recorded for analysis

steps.action: Measure conflict detection latency by calculating time between request receipt and conflict flag creation
steps.expectedResult: Conflict detection latency is measured for all 50 conflict scenarios

steps.action: Verify that 95th percentile conflict detection latency is under 1 second
steps.expectedResult: 95% of conflict detections complete within 1 second, meeting performance SLA

steps.action: Analyze CPU usage metrics during peak concurrent load
steps.expectedResult: CPU usage remains below 80% threshold, indicating sufficient processing capacity

steps.action: Review memory consumption patterns throughout the load test
steps.expectedResult: Memory usage stays within acceptable limits (below 85%), no memory leaks detected

steps.action: Check database connection pool utilization and query performance
steps.expectedResult: Database connections are managed efficiently, no connection pool exhaustion, query execution times remain optimal

steps.action: Verify system throughput by calculating successful transactions per second
steps.expectedResult: System maintains minimum throughput of 10 transactions per second under concurrent load

steps.action: Review error logs for any failures, timeouts, or exceptions during load test
steps.expectedResult: Error rate is below 1%, no critical errors or system crashes occurred

postconditions: System maintains conflict detection latency under 1 second for 95% of requests
All system resources operate within defined performance thresholds
No performance degradation or system instability after load test completion
Performance metrics are documented for baseline comparison
System successfully processes high volume of concurrent updates without data loss
Database integrity is maintained with no corruption or inconsistencies
